full_summary:
**Fishing Vessel Charter for Mackerel Egg Research Survey**

government of Canada
Fisheries and Oceans Canada

### Invitation to Tender

**Contract Reference:** 30004286/A

**Publish Date:** 2023-06-20

**Close Date:** 2023-07-04T13:00:00

**Description:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites eligible contractors to participate in a fishing vessel charter for a mackerel egg research survey in the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO) zones 4R and 3Pns.

**Background:**

The Science Sector of DFO requires a fishing vessel and crew to conduct an ichthyoplankton research survey in July 2023 to assess the abundance and distribution of Atlantic mackerel eggs and larvae outside of their main spawning site in the southern Gulf of Saint Lawrence. This information will support stock assessments for the commercially exploited species and inform conservation and management measures for the resource.

**Scope of Work:**

The contractor must provide a suitable fishing vessel, crew, and necessary equipment to conduct the mackerel egg research survey in NAFO zones 4R and 3Pns. The survey must be completed by July 31, 2023.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The selection of the contractor will be based on the combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Process for Bidding:**

Eligible contractors must submit their bids electronically by 13:00 Eastern Daylight Time on July 4, 2023, to the contact person below. Late bids will not be accepted.

**Contract Requirements:**

- provide a suitable fishing vessel and crew to conduct the mackerel egg research survey
- meet the specified scientific and operational requirements outlined in the bid documents
- adhere to all applicable laws and regulations

**Award Criteria:**

The DFO will award the contract to the bidder that achieves the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

### Contract Information

- **Contract Value:**  TBD
- **Duration:**  8 months
- **Location:**  NAFO zones 4R and 3Pns, Canada

### Contact Information:

For further information, please contact:
Terri Jones, Contracting Authority
Fisheries and Oceans Canada
Phone: (506) 461-3743
Email: [terri.jones@dfo-mpo.gc.ca][1]

> [1]: mailto:terri.jones@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
